alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 9:22AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga and Lake. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 922 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cleveland, Willowick, Parma, Lakewood, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Strongsville, Willoughby, Eastlake, Warrensville Heights, Highland Hills, Timberlake, Lakeline, Garfield Heights, Shaker Heights, Maple Heights, South Euclid, Parma Heights and Rocky River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
